explanation_of_expression: Refers to the current week, the period of time starting from the present day and extending to the end of the week.
image_description0: A calendar with the current week highlighted.
image_description1: A calendar with the current week marked in a different color to distinguish it from other weeks.
image_description2: A calendar with the current week emphasized and highlighted to draw attention to it.
image_description3: An image of a calendar showing the current week.
explanation_of_syllables: 이번 - this (referring to the current), 주 - week
sentence_example: 이번 주에는 바쁜 일정이 많아요. (This week, I have a lot of busy schedules.)

image_description0: A bicycle parked next to a tree in a park
image_description1: A bicycle parked under a shady tree in a park
image_description2: A serene park scene with a bicycle parked under a tree
image_description3: A person riding a bicycle along a peaceful path in a park
explanation_of_syllables: 자 - self (referring to oneself), 전 - move (referring to movement), 거 - thing (referring to a bicycle), 를 - object particle, 타 - ride (referring to riding), 다 - to do (verb ending)
sentence_example: 오늘은 친구들과 함께 자전거를 타러 공원에 갔어요. (Today, I went to the park with my friends to ride bicycles.)

explanation_of_expression: This expression means to have lunch or to eat lunch.
image_description0: A plate with food on it, representing having lunch.
image_description1: A plate with food on it, symbolizing having lunch.
image_description2: A plate with delicious food on it, representing the act of having lunch.
image_description3: An image of a plate with food on it, illustrating the concept of having lunch.
explanation_of_syllables: 점 - point (it refers to a specific time or moment), 심 - heart (it represents the concept of eating as a way to nourish the heart and soul), 을 - object particle, 먹 - to eat, 다 - verb ending
sentence_example: 오늘은 친구와 함께 점심을 먹었어요. (Today, I had lunch with my friend.)

explanation_of_expression: Jeju Island is a popular tourist destination in South Korea known for its beautiful landscapes, volcanic terrain, and unique culture.
image_description0: A picturesque island with lush green mountains, clear blue waters, and sandy beaches.
image_description1: Jeju Island is a stunning paradise with breathtaking natural beauty, including mountains, beaches, and crystal-clear waters.
image_description2: Imagine a tropical paradise with stunning landscapes, towering mountains, and pristine beaches - that's Jeju Island.
image_description3: An image of Jeju Island showcasing its natural beauty, including mountains, beaches, and volcanic terrain.
explanation_of_syllables: 제 - Je (refers to Jeju Island), 주 - Ju (means 'province' in Korean), 도 - Do (means 'island' in Korean)
sentence_example: 제주도에 가면 아름다운 풍경과 특별한 문화를 경험할 수 있어요. (If you go to Jeju Island, you can experience beautiful landscapes and unique culture.)

explanation_of_expression: 지난주 refers to the week that has just passed, the week before the current week.
image_description0: A calendar with the previous week highlighted.
image_description1: A calendar with the previous week marked in a different color to distinguish it from the current week.
image_description2: A visual representation of time passing, with the previous week fading away and the current week becoming more prominent.
image_description3: An image showing a timeline with the previous week marked as a separate section.
explanation_of_syllables: 지난 - past, previous (referring to something that has already happened), 주 - week
sentence_example: 지난주에는 바쁜 일정이 많았어요. (Last week, I had a busy schedule.)

explanation_of_expression: Taekwondo is a Korean martial art that emphasizes high kicks, jumping and spinning kicks, and fast kicking techniques.
image_description0: An image of a person performing a high kick in mid-air.
image_description1: An image of a person executing a powerful kick with perfect form.
image_description2: A person demonstrating their agility and strength by performing a series of high kicks in rapid succession.
image_description3: An image showing a person wearing a Taekwondo uniform and performing a flying kick.
image_tags: Agility, Strength, Discipline, Focus, Training, Martial arts,
explanation_of_syllables: 태 - to stomp or strike with the foot, 권 - fist or martial arts, 도 - the way or path
sentence_example: 나는 태권도를 배우고 있어요. (I am learning Taekwondo.)

explanation_of_expression: A social gathering of people to celebrate a special occasion or event.
image_description0: A colorful room filled with balloons, streamers, and a big cake in the center.
image_description1: A festive room decorated with colorful balloons, streamers, and a large cake in the middle.
image_description2: In a vibrant room, there are colorful balloons, streamers, and a grand cake placed at the center, creating a lively atmosphere for celebration.
image_description3: An image of a lively party with people dancing, colorful decorations, and a festive atmosphere.
explanation_of_syllables: 파 - division (it represents the concept of people coming together), 티 - tea (it refers to a social gathering where people come together to enjoy food and drinks)
sentence_example: 오늘은 친구들과 파티를 열었어요. (Today, I had a party with my friends.)

explanation_of_expression: 평일 refers to the days of the week from Monday to Friday, excluding weekends.
image_description0: An image of a calendar with the weekdays highlighted.
image_description1: The expression 평일 is represented by a calendar with the weekdays clearly marked.
image_description2: Imagine a calendar with the weekdays prominently displayed, emphasizing the concept of 평일.
image_description3: An image showing a calendar with Monday to Friday highlighted to represent 평일.
explanation_of_syllables: 평 - ordinary, regular (it represents the concept of normal or typical), 일 - day
sentence_example: 평일에는 학교에 가야 해요. (I have to go to school on weekdays.)

explanation_of_expression: 화요일 is the Korean word for Tuesday.
image_description0: A calendar with the date marked as Tuesday.
image_description1: A calendar with the date marked as Tuesday.
image_description2: A calendar with the date highlighted as Tuesday.
image_description3: A calendar with the date marked as Tuesday.
explanation_of_syllables: 화 - fire (it represents the concept of energy and movement), 요 - desire (it refers to the desire for progress and achievement), 일 - day

explanation_of_expression: A type of paper used for personal hygiene, especially for wiping or cleaning the face, hands, or other parts of the body.
image_description0: A roll of white paper with a pattern of small squares on it.
image_description1: A roll of white paper with a pattern of small squares on it, used for personal hygiene.
image_description2: A roll of white paper with a pattern of small squares on it, symbolizing personal hygiene and cleanliness.
image_description3: A roll of white paper with a pattern of small squares on it, used for wiping or cleaning.
explanation_of_syllables: 화장 - makeup (it represents the concept of applying something on the face), 지 - paper
sentence_example: 화장지를 사용해서 손을 깨끗하게 닦았어요. (I used tissue to clean my hands.)
